intro: Silene gigantea subsp. epirota, commonly known as the Epirus catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and hairy, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Silene gigantea subsp. epirota is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
